item.title: AWS Site-to-Site VPN
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki Direct Connect AWS Site-to-Site VPN Offers the quickest way to create a network link between an AWS environment and an on-premises environment, or another cloud.

item.title: AWS VPC
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki Virtual Private Cloud (AWS VPC) Note: /32 after an IP address denotes one IP address, while /0 refers to the entire network.

item.title: Direct Connect (DX)
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki Site-to-Site VPN Transit Gateway Direct Connect Direct Connect is AWS’s physical private link connecting your business premises to its public and private services

item.title: Egress-Only Internet Gateway
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki NAT Gateway Egress-Only Internet Gateway Egress-Only Internet Gateway is an outbound-only Internet Gateway that allows private IPv6 resources in your VPC’s private subnets to initiate a connection to the public internet and public AWS services without allowing the Internet to initiate a connection (egress) to your resources.

item.title: Global Accelerator
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki CloudFront Global Accelerator Similar to CloudFront, in that they both improve performance, but they each do so in different ways, for different reasons.

item.title: Internet Gateway
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki VPC VPC Router Internet Gateway Region resilient gateway attached to a VPC You do not need a gateway per availability zone 1 VPC = 0 or 1 IGW, 1 IGW = 0 or 1 VPC Runs from within the AWS Public Zone Gateways traffic between the VPC and the Internet or AWS Public Zone (S3, SQS, SNS, etc.

item.title: NACLs and Security Groups
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki VPC Network Access Control List (NACL) NACLs are associated with subnets Connections between resources within a subnet are NOT affected by NACLs Each NACL contains 2 sets of rules Inbound Rules - Affect data entering the subnet Outbound Rules - Affect data leaving the subnet These rule sets are only focused on the direction of the traffic, not necessarily whether it’s a request or a response.

item.title: NAT Gateway
item.description: Related Notes: AWS Wiki Egress-Only Internet Gateway VPC Gateway Endpoints VPC Interface Endpoints Helpful Links VPC Pricing If you choose to create a NAT gateway in your VPC, you are charged for each â€œNAT Gateway-hour" that your gateway is provisioned and available.

item.title: PrivateLink
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki VPC Interface Endpoints PrivateLink AWS PrivateLink provides private connectivity between VPCs, AWS services, and your on-premises networks, without exposing your traffic to the public internet.

item.title: Transit Gateway
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki Direct Connect Transit Gateway The AWS Transit Gateway is a network gateway which can be used to significantly simplify networking between VPC’s, VPN, and Direct Connect It can be used to peer VPCs in the same account, different account, same or different region and supports transitive routing between networks Network Transit Hub to connect VPCs to on-premises networks Significantly reduces network complexity, especially as you scale, reduces number of VPN tunnels Single network object - HA and Scalable Highly available inter-VPC router, allows VPCs to talk to each other through the Transit Gateway Support Transitive Routing Share between accounts using AWS RAM Transit Gateways can also be peered with Transit Gateways in other regions or cross account This can be used to create a global network within AWS Creates attachments to other network types VPC Site-to-Site VPN Direct Connect Gateway AWS Transit Gateway is a service that enables customers to connect their VPC Clouds and their on-premises networks to a single gateway.

item.title: VPC Gateway Endpoints
item.description: Related Notes: AWS Wiki Virtual Private Cloud (VPC) VPC Interface Endpoints VPC Endpoints (Gateway Endpoints) Provides private access to supported AWS services like S3 and DynamoDB (public services) Allows a private-only resource inside of a VPC to access S3 and DynamoDB Allows any resource inside a private-only VPC to access S3 and DynamoDB.

item.title: VPC Interface Endpoints
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki VPC Gateway Endpoints VPC Endpoints (Interface Endpoints) Similar to VPC Gateway Endpoints, Interface Endpoints allow private access to AWS Public Services.

item.title: VPC Router
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki VPC Internet Gateway VPC Router Every VPC has a VPC Router - Highly available In every subnet .

item.title: VPN CloudHub
item.description: Related Notes AWS Wiki AWS VPN CloudHub Capable of wiring multiple AWS Site-to-Site VPN connections together on a virtual private gateway.
